donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr:
The Program aims to address key strategic gaps in the HIV/AIDS response based on identified priority areas: 
•	Development of the National Strategic Plan on AIDS;
•	Reduction of HIV-associated stigma;
•	Containment of the spread of HIV infection among vulnerable and most-at-risk-groups;
•	Appropriate treatment, care and support for People living with and affected by HIV/AIDS (PLWHA); and
•	Strengthening of capacities of governmental and non-governmental stakeholders to support a stronger response to HIV/AIDS.

The overall goals of the program are to:
•	Halt the spread of HIV/AIDS and Sexually Transmitted Infections (STI) amongst the most at 
 risk groups and the general population; and
•	Improve the quality of life for People living with and affected by HIV/AIDS.

These broad goals will be achieved through three key objectives namely: 
I.	Strengthen community action to maintain low HIV prevalence particularly among populations most at risk and vulnerable in partnership with NGOs.
II.	Reduce morbidity and mortality through improved access to treatment, care and psycho-social support to those infected and affected.
III.	Reinforce capacities, partnerships, coordination, monitoring and evaluation of the national response in line with the three ones.

Target Group/Beneficiaries:
•	Populations most at risk (injecting drug users, sex workers);
•	Vulnerable groups (labor migrants, youth, women, prisoners);
•	People living with HIV/AIDS and their families; and
•	STI patients and blood recipients

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr:
Programme Partners: 
Principal Recipient (PR): UNDP/PAPP
Sub-Recipients (SRs): MoH, UNRWA, and WHO

Goal: 
To reduce the burden and maintain a low transmission level of TB (tuberculosis) in the West Bank and Gaza, particularly among vulnerable groups including the disadvantaged, refugees and Bedouin communities by 2015 in line with the Millennium Development Goals and the Stop TB Partnership targets.

Target Group/Beneficiaries: 
Bedouin populations; Refugees; Migrants; and Socially and economically disadvantaged groups.

Strategies:
-  Strengthen program management capacity in West Bank and the Gaza Strip;
- Pursue high quality DOTS (Directly Observed Treatment, Short-course) expansion and enhancement;
- Address major challenges such as access to services for refugees and Bedouin populations and contact tracing; and
- Enable and promote research.

project_descr: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria funded two projects one for AIDS and one for Tuberculosis in the oPt
